item.title: Watch: Smoke rises in Tehran as explosions heard across country
item.summary: The BBC's Jon Donnison in Jerusalem reports as Trump says "major combat operations" have begun.

item.title: Mahmood to press on with immigration reforms despite by-election defeat
item.summary: The home secretary is to double down on plans for Danish-style restrictions on asylum seekers.

item.title: Henry Zeffman: Green victory shows insurgent parties are here to stay
item.summary: The party's historic win in Gorton and Denton by-election is clearest sign yet of changing political landscape.

item.title: Man charged after Churchill statue defaced, police say
item.summary: Caspar San Giorgio, 38, of no fixed address was arrested on Friday, police say.

item.title: Boy assaulted by birth parents wins campaign for UK child cruelty register
item.summary: Tony Hudgell, who lost both legs after his birth parents assaulted him, has fought to protect children.

item.title: The mystery man who links Andrew with Jeffrey Epstein
item.summary: For nearly a decade, David Stern acted as a key conduit between Jeffrey Epstein and Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor.

item.title: Bill Clinton asked about hot tub photo and testifies he knew 'nothing' of Epstein crimes
item.summary: The former president told the committee that he would never have flown on Epstein's plane if he "had any inkling of what he was doing".

item.title: At least 15 killed after military plane carrying banknotes crashes in Bolivia
item.summary: Police fire tear gas to disperse crowds allegedly trying to take banknotes from the crash site.

item.title: Neil Sedaka, singer of Breaking Up Is Hard To Do, dies at 86
item.summary: A skilled pianist nominated for five Grammy awards, Sedaka wrote hits through the 1950's and 60's.

item.title: Rent tops Â£1,000 a month in more areas - find out where
item.summary: The cost of renting privately has surged in the last five years, but tenants may now see a slowdown.
